alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 08 at 4:08AM EST until January 10 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 to 70 mph possible, with the highest gusts along the Downeast coast. * WHERE...Southern Penobscot, Interior Hancock, Central Washington, Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties. * WHEN...From very late Tuesday night through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow loading on trees and power lines prior to melting after the changeover to all rain could also add to impacts from this event.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot
